result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard M. Voiles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Review on May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Review on February 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard M. Voiles in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Richard M. Voiles in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai advises matters are resolved and gives recommendation.   State agrees ast noted.  Victim notification met.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statements reviewed.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2:
12 months Probation
No contact with victim unless with agent approval.
Anger management, domestic abuse counseling and any other counseling.
70 days credit if revoked.
Submit to DNA sample
AODA & treatment
$243.00 Fine/Costs fees and $200.00 DNA surcharge, $100.00 Dom Abuse surcharge (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.

Cash bond to be applied from Case No. 15CM658
Count 1 & 3 Dismissed and read in.

Return date at 04-01-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Richard M. Voiles in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Richard M. Voiles in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Need PTC and RD.  Bond continues. Pre-trial conference at 02-19-2016 11:00 am.

Defendant Richard M. Voiles appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation. State requests $500 Cash bond. Atty. ORourke has no argument to no contact but argues absolute sobriety.   File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/CS;  Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
